subject: Re: [junit] Re: DbUnit & ORM
msgSnippet: ... Although this would still be code modification... you could do it in TestNG with an ignore annotation. As long as TestNG still reported it (e.g. as
messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:
> I saw no reason why a modification to the dynamic model ("now I want to run
> a different set of tests") should force me to change the static model (in
> JUnit, you will usually comment out or rename a few test methods, or modify
> your suite() method).
>
> I actually thought this was dangerous because you will comment out tests
> that you might forget about later.

Although this would still be code modification... you could do it in TestNG
with an 'ignore' annotation. As long as TestNG still reported it (e.g. as
skipped, or as explicitly ignored), it shouldn't be forgotten.

(In JUnit, one way to avoid forgetting is to comment out the body of the
test, and then assert that the test is being run before a particular date.
If you do forget, you automatically get a "wake up call" when the date is
passed)

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
